cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward southeast Louisiana and the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (near the New Orleans–Port Fourchon–Morgan City corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through Louisiana to coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely by early Sunday; hurricane-force winds possible by Sunday afternoon with a 21% chance of 50-kt winds and up to an 8% chance of 64-kt (major-hurricane) winds at the port vicinity.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 7–11 ft possible along the southeast Louisiana coast, including areas adjacent to the Port of South Louisiana and the lower Mississippi River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches possible, leading to considerable flash, urban, and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, large and destructive waves, coastal inundation, and potential prolonged power outages that could disrupt port operations.
